CatDescriptText: Mr. Alonzo Poellnitz, 7145 Tilden Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that they ought to work. And the reason is that it interferes with their schooling.  The children need all the time, which they can get, for school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alonzo Poellnitz wearing apron and gloves, leaning on car tire in front of brick wall with window
